TopicTitle: Mod to make astronaut skills less silly!

Articles.Content:
I really love the new additions in 0.9.... except one thing!

It's really very odd that only one type of astronaut can flick a switch marked "SAS" and only one type can fix faults.

What I would really like is either;

1. a single type of Kerbal with all 3 skills (still upgradable with xp)

or

2. The existing 3 types of kerbal but with at least some skill in each area as follows...

Scientist - can use weak SAS, fix some faults, gets bonus to science

Astronaut - Can use full SAS, fix some faults, lower science return

Engineer - Can use weak SAS, fix all faults, lower science return

Ideally of the two I would prefer to see just one type of Kerbal with all 3 skills but that depends on whether the 3 separate skills actually have separate XP points (e.g you only get scientist exp from performing science).

Can anyone help? It's a bit silly as it is and makes single kerbal craft pretty useless.

If it's not possible then just a mod to completely remove the new system would have to do.

Actually... I've just made a quick version myself. Will test and see how well it works.

Mod is here - http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/103288-Beta-0-9-Multi-tasking-Kerbals!-V1-0-Testers-feedback-needed

It would still be great if someone with more skill than me could make a version that keeps three separate experience bars.

Edited December 16, 2014 by Mulbin

Why is it silly? IRL people are specialized, too. There's the pilot, the mission commander, payload specialist, etc. And only a few of them are trained to do other stuff, only to have a backup.

Why? I takes years to become an expert in one subject and nothing less than an expert will be allowed to go to space.

The current system does undermine the usefulness of a 1 kerbal space craft a bit, though I think most of the time you probably just need one high level probe and an engineer for most stuff. Perhaps later on, this will be fleshed out and we have actual meaningful specialization rather than arbitrary limitation like now. I guess something like this does work as a stopgap measure for those who do not like the new specialization system.

That said, I kind of like story potential from the current system....

Jeb went out on EVA, but forgot to shutdown thrust, sending Bob and Bill off into space. The two frantically turned off the engine, but now they are stuck spinning like crazy in an orbit around mun with no knowledge to control the craft. Rescue mission for both jebs and the spinning craft begins! Imagine trying to grab that spinning craft with a claw!
